required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of the Use of the Q Aspiration Catheter to Remove Clot in Stroke Patients
clinical_study.official_title: An Observational Study of the Q Aspiration Catheter Used During Neurointervention for Acute Large Vessel Ischemic Stroke in Spain.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to collect real-world safety and performance data on the MIVI Neuroscience, Inc. Q Aspiration Catheter for use in the removal of fresh, soft emboli and thrombi in the neurovascular system during acute ischemic stroke.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to demonstrate the safety and performance of the MIVI Neuroscience, Inc. CE Marked Q Aspiration Catheter for use in the removal of fresh, soft emboli and thrombi in the neurovascular system during acute ischemic stroke. The study is an observational study collecting Q Aspiration Catheter use that will enroll a maximum of 50 subjects at a maximum of 5 sites in Spain. Subjects data will be collected through hospitalization with a 3 months post-procedure study visit. This study is designed for observational data to be collected and reported.

primary_outcome.description: Defined as final modified Thrombolysis In Cerebral Infarction scale (mTICI 2b-3) flow in the target vessel
Defined as the symptomatic intracranial haemorrhage as detected by CT/MRI with an NIHSS change of >/= 4 points

secondary_outcome.measure: Successful revascularization rate using the Q Aspiration Catheter alone
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as mTICI 2b-3 flow in the target vessel post-treatment with the Q Catheter (first line therapy)

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of embolization to a new neurovascular territory (ENT)
Good functional outcome measured by Modified Rankin Scale score of 0-2
secondary_outcome.description: The Modified Rankin Scale (mRS) measures neurological disability or dependence for stroke patients on a scale of 0 (no symptoms) to 6 (deceased).

arm_group.description: mechanical thrombectomy for acute ischemic stroke

intervention.description: The Q Aspiration Catheter is indicated for use in the removal of fresh, soft emboli and thrombi in the neurovascular system.

study_pop.textblock: Population is patients diagnosed with large vessel occlusion acute ischemic stroke within 8 hours of stroke onset treated with mechanical aspiration thrombectomy with the Q Aspiration Catheter as first line therapy.

overall_official.last_name: Mariano Espinosa de Rueda Ruiz, MD

facility.name: Hospital Universitario de Santiago de Compostela
